Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Vice President Mike Pence's statement by attributing to him the quote "What the American people need is not more health care. What we need is more Jesus care." The quote is entirely fabricated and there is no public record of Pence ever saying such a thing.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or proof provided to validate the quote attributed to Vice President Mike Pence.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Vice President Mike Pence believes that people with pre-existing health conditions would be better off going to church rather than seeking healthcare.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation for why Vice President Mike Pence would make such a statement, as it is entirely fabricated.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Vice President Mike Pence never made the statement attributed to him.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by including grammatical anomalies in the fabricated quote attributed to Vice President Mike Pence.
Understate: The claim does not understate any information or facts.
